question: What will happen to a ball if it is dropped from a spacecraft revolving around the earth at a height of 120 km?
option1: It will go very far in the space
option2: It will fall down to the earth gradually
option3: If will move with the same speed tangentially to the spacecraft
option4: It will continue to move with velocity v along the original orbit of spacecraft
answer: It will continue to move with velocity v along the original orbit of spacecraft
explanation: If a ball is dropped from a spacecraft revolving around the earth at a height of 120 km, it will continue to move with velocity v along the original orbit of spacecraft. As the ball possess same initial tangential speed as that of space craft. So, it also feels the condition of weightlessness.
